title: Corrections & Amplifications
body:
An antitrust lawsuit against Alphabet Inc.’s Google was filed by 38 attorneys general from states, territories and Washington, D.C. A Page One article and a What’s News item Friday incorrectly said 38 states joined the lawsuit. Also, the article incorrectly identified Iowa Attorney General Tom Miller, a Democrat, as a Republican.
Wisconsin absentee ballots use an envelope signed by a witness who also must write his or her address. A U.S. News article Tuesday about a Trump campaign lawsuit incorrectly said the witness must write the voter’s address.
A map showing whether countries recognize Israel that accompanied a World News article Thursday failed to label Lebanon, which doesn’t recognize Israel.
PQ Group Holdings Inc. declared a special dividend of $1.80 a share following the completion of the sale of its performance materials business. The Dividend Changes table in Thursday’s Business & Finance section incorrectly listed the dividend as an initial dividend.
Readers can alert The Wall Street Journal to any errors in news articles by emailing wsjcontact@wsj.com or by calling 888-410-2667.
